column4: thanks mnepton.  actually I'm trying to activate cpu frequency scaling, both cpu keep running in the 110F range when I'm not doing anything
it only happened when I upgraded to edgy, so I guessed that there was a problem with dual core recognition in the new kernel
yes, it's a notebook, HPdv2000.  I'll take a look at the laptop testing page
/proc/cpuinfo should return only one CPU even though I'm dual core, right?
hmm, top seems to have only one list given
what type of cpu do you have?
1.73Ghz dual-core intel 32... believe that's called a yonah?
just install linux-image-generic
that will get a kernel with smp support and more specific for your cpu
ok, I'll check gkrellm and then try switching the kernel
yeah I'm assuming you are using the default kernel.  That is yoru problem.
yeah you are using the default kernel. Install linux-image-generic and all will be okay.
np
my /proc/cpuinfo shows one as well.
don't you only have one
dual core, one processor.  in dapper this showed up as two
yeah I don't believe its going to show up as 2 anyumore.  Even though the system knows there are 2 cores.
any guesses as to why things are running so much hotter than before?  the fan's on all the time
hotter than when?
cwillu: than under dapper
you already hav ea multi app installer  no need for automatix
automatix is a hacked way of installing software it doesn't do it properly and removal is a PITA
it's just nice to have a suggested list of apps, esp. if I don't know what I'll be needing if I'm new to linux
